title.en: PivMeta: An ontology draft for describing particle image velocimetry data.

author: Matthias Probst (https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8729-0482), Institut für Thermische Strömungsmaschinen

creator.value: Matthias Probst (https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8729-0482), Institut für Thermische Strömungsmaschinen

abstract.value: This is an ontology draft for the description of Particle Image Velocimetry data. It is currently limited to planar PIV (2D2C and 2D3C) setups.

title.value: PivMeta: An ontology draft for describing particle image velocimetry data.

definition.value: PIV image source type. Used to describe whether images were generated (synthetically) or measured (experimentally).

example.value: Examples are synthetic or experimental sources.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, added German label, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

definition.value: A unit of measure, or unit is a particular quantity value that has been chosen as a scale for measuring other quantities the same kind (more generally of equivalent dimension). For example, the meter is a quantity of length that has been rigorously defined and standardized by the BIPM (International Board of Weights and Measures). Any measurement of the length can be expressed as a number multiplied by the unit meter. More formally, the value of physical quanitity Q with respect to a unit (U) is expressed as the scalar multiple of a real number (n) and U, as Q = nU.

example.value: Typically used to describe the particle image density in a PIV image, also known as ppp (particle per pixel).

description.en: Millimeters per pixel, representing the optical magnification where the length in millimeters corresponds to the number of pixels in the image.

definition.value: Refers to one or generally many tracer particles, also called seeding particles. Its parameters should be described via m4i:hasParameter.

example.value: For data property pivmeta:material, please provide a wikidata URI, for e.g. for DEHS use https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q4387284.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added german labels, added skos:prefLabel, added skos:definition, added german definition, added instances

definition.value: Eine Person als Akteur ist eine natürliche Person, also ein handelnder Mensch.
Person agents are people.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added german labels, added skos:prefLabel, added skos:definition, added german definition, added instances

definition.value: An agent is something that bears some form of responsibility for an activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity.

Refers to one or generally many synthetically generated (modelled) tracer particles, also called seeding particles. Its parameters should be described via m4i:hasParameter. The source code generating the particles should be stated via codemeta:hasSourceCode.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, added german labels, removed redundant notes, removed other languages than english in comment, label, changeNote and definition

definition.value: A specific representation of a dataset. A dataset might be available in multiple serializations that may differ in various ways, including natural language, media-type or format, schematic organization, temporal and spatial resolution, level of detail or profiles (which might specify any or all of the above).

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, adjusted german labels, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

definition.value: Variable, i.e., a conventional that is employed for something to which values can be assigned (this may include different notations for the same variable including, e.g., computational representations); this is to be understood very generally, e.g., a variable may be an array or set of elements or have another kind of internal structure
The least square residual of the z displacement reconstruction in stereo PIV.
The width of the sensor in pixel.
Image scaling factor.

Fill factor in vertical direction. The fill factor of an image sensor array is the ratio of a pixel's light sensitive area to its total area. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fill_factor_(image_sensor). The value must be between 0 and 1, where 1 depicts a 100 percent. The higher the fill factor, the more sensitive the sensor.
The standard name y_derivative_of_z_velocity denotes the derivative of the z component of the velocity vector with respect to the y coordinate.
Width and height of a square initial PIV interrogation window (in case of a multi-grid PIV algorithm).
The size of the image filter kernel.

Fill factor in horizontal direction. The fill factor of an image sensor array is the ratio of a pixel's light sensitive area to its total area. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fill_factor_(image_sensor). The value must be between 0 and 1, where 1 depicts a 100 percent. The higher the fill factor, the more sensitive the sensor.
Velocity is defined as a three-dimensional velocity vector. Magnitude denotes the length of the vector.
Width and height of a square final PIV interrogation window.
PIV pixel displacement magnitude in the image plane.
Height of the initial PIV interrogation window (in case of a multi-grid PIV algorithm).
The standard name x_derivative_of_x_velocity denotes the derivative of the x component of the velocity vector with respect to the x coordinate.

Displacement is a vector quantity. X indicates the component in x-axis direction. This component is an in-plane component. The displacement is computed based on the second peak of the cross-correlation function.
The width of a ccd pixel.
Velocity is defined as a three-dimensional velocity vector. z indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing z.
The pixel depth of an image in bits. Typical bit depth are 8 bits or 16 bits.

The correlation coefficient is a measure for the quality of the PIV evaluation. It is computed based on the cross-correlation of the interrogation windows. The first peak correlation coefficient is the correlation coefficient of the first peak of the cross-correlation function.
y indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y.Displacement is a vector quantity and describes the particle displacement in pixels in the image plane.
The optical magnification of the imaging system.

The correlation coefficient is a measure for the quality of the PIV evaluation. It is computed based on the cross-correlation of the interrogation windows. The first peak correlation coefficient is the correlation coefficient of the third peak of the cross-correlation function.
Recording time since start of recording.
Number of seeding particles in the image or field of interest. See also image_particle_density.
Time between two laser pulses.
The standard name z_derivative_of_x_velocity denotes the derivative of the x component of the velocity vector with respect to the z coordinate.
The standard name x_derivative_of_y_velocity denotes the derivative of the y component of the velocity vector with respect to the x coordinate.
Index of a PIV image collection. Starts at 1 and ends at the number of images N.
The height of the final PIV interrogation window.

The correlation coefficient is a measure for the quality of the PIV evaluation. It is computed based on the cross-correlation of the interrogation windows. The first peak correlation coefficient is the correlation coefficient of the second peak of the cross-correlation function.
The standard deviation of the image particle diameter in the field of interest.

The shape factor used to model the expanded laser beam. The shape factor is introduced in 'Particle Image Velocimetry A Practical Guide' by Raffel et al. (2018). It deforms a Gaussian beam. High values result in a more top-hat-like beam, while low values result in a more Gaussian-like beam.

A flag indicates the processing status of a vector. It can be disabled, active or processed in any other way by a post-processing step. The flag meaning must be provided with the dataset through flag meanings and flag values. Recommendation for the flag meaning are 0-inactive, 1-active, 2-masked, 4-no result, 8-disabled, 16-filtered, 32-interpolated, 64-replaced, 128-manualedit. Combinations of the flags can be used by bitwise OR operation. For example, 33 would mean that the vector is active and interpolated.
The standard name y_derivative_of_y_velocity denotes the derivative of the y component of the velocity vector with respect to the y coordinate.
The spatial coordinate in horizontal direction. The origin is at the top left.

Pixel coordinate in vertical direction. It depicts the position of each velocity vector in the result data in pixel units, where the origin is at the lower left. The coordinate is aligned with the physical coordinate axis (y_coordinate), not the image coordinate (y_image_coordinate) which has its origin in the top left of the image.
Datetime in ISO 8601 format.
Number of particle images per pixel. Equals the number of particles divided by the image area.
The standard deviation of the seeding particles sizes.
Width of a final PIV interrogation window.
The focal length. See also https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q193540.
The physical offset of the y_image_origin_coordinate in the global coordinate system.
The standard name x_derivative_of_z_velocity denotes the derivative of the z component of the velocity vector with respect to the x coordinate.
The signal to noise ratio of the PIV evaluation.

Arithmetic mean of the image particle diameters in the flow. The diameter of an image particle approximated by a circular Gaussian intensity bell, where the diameter is defined at the e-2 intensity, thus the particle diameter is equal to 4 sigma of the Gaussian distribution. Note, that there might be other definitions, too, however, this one is the most common one in literature.
Velocity is defined as a three-dimensional velocity vector. x indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x.

The width of the laser sheet illuminating the seeding particles as used in a model (synthetic PIV. The width is defined at the e-2 intensity of a Gaussian bell curve. However, the laser beam shape must not be Gaussian, but can be more top-hat-like. The shape is defined by the shap factor (laser_sheet_shape_factor).

The spatial coordinate in vertical direction in the global coordinate system, which is aligned with the sensor orientation. The sensor width therefore corresponds to sensor size in direction of y_coordinate.

The standard name inplane_velocity denotes the magnitude of a two-dimensional velocity vector, which . Plane is spanned by the x and y axis of PIV plane. The PIV plane is the plane illuminated by the laser. The component in the third direction is called outofplane_velocity.

The standard name inplane_velocity denotes the magnitude of a two-dimensional velocity vector. Plane is spanned by the x and y axis of PIV plane. The PIV plane is the plane illuminated by the laser. x indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x.
The standard name y_derivative_of_x_velocity denotes the derivative of the x component of the velocity vector with respect to the y coordinate.

Displacement is a vector quantity. Y indicates the component in y-axis direction. This component is an in-plane component. The displacement is computed based on the second peak of the cross-correlation function.
Width of a final PIV interrogation window overlap.
The height of the sensor in pixel.
The arithmetic mean of the diameter of the seeding particles.
Displacement is a vector quantity and describes the particle displacement in pixels in the image plane. x indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x.

The standard name inplane_velocity denotes the magnitude of a two-dimensional velocity vector. Plane is spanned by the x and y axis of PIV plane. The PIV plane is the plane illuminated by the laser. y indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing x.

hasStandardNameDescription.value: The correlation coefficient is a measure for the quality of the PIV evaluation. It is computed based on the cross-correlation of the interrogation windows. The first peak correlation coeficient is the correlation coefficient of the first peak of the cross-correlation function.

definition.value: The laser sheet thickness used in a measurement. For a model laser sheet thickness, use model_laser_sheet_thickness. The use of laser_sheet_thickness has no clear definition, but is where the intensity of the laser sheet drops significantly.

The spatial coordinate in horizontal direction in the global coordinate system, which is aligned with the sensor orientation. The sensor width therefore corresponds to sensor size in direction of x_coordinate.
The physical offset of the x_image_origin_coordinate in the global coordinate system.
Width of a initial PIV interrogation window (in case of a multi-grid PIV algorithm).
Width and height of a square final PIV interrogation window overlap.
The correlation coefficient is a measure for the quality of the PIV evaluation. It is computed based on the cross-correlation of the interrogation windows.

The diameter of an image particle approximated by a circular Gaussian intensity bell, where the diameter is defined at the e-2 intensity, thus the particle diameter is equal to 4 sigma of the Gaussian distribution. Note, that there might be other definitions, too, however, this one is the most common one in literature.

Displacement is a vector quantity. Y indicates the component in y-axis direction. This component is an in-plane component. The displacement is computed based on the first peak of the cross-correlation function.
The spatial coordinate in vertical direction. The origin is in the top left.

Displacement is a vector quantity. X indicates the component in x-axis direction. This component is an in-plane component. The displacement is computed based on the third peak of the cross-correlation function.

Displacement is a vector quantity. Y indicates the component in y-axis direction. This component is an in-plane component. The displacement is computed based on the third peak of the cross-correlation function.
The image density is computed based on the source density $N_s$ and the interrogation window size.
Velocity is defined as a three-dimensional velocity vector. y indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y.

Displacement is a vector quantity. X indicates the component in x-axis direction. This component is an in-plane component. The displacement is computed based on the first peak of the cross-correlation function.

Pixel coordinate in horizontal direction. It depicts the position of each velocity vector in the result data in pixel units, where the origin is at the lower left. The coordinate is aligned with the physical coordinate axis (x_coordinate), not the image coordinate (x_image_coordinate) which has its origin in the top left of the image.
Number of pixels in the field of interest that exceed the maximal senor count.
The height of a ccd pixel.
The height of a final PIV interrogation window overlap.

example.value: Can be direct subtraction of background, division of image by background or a combination.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, adjusted german labels,  harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

comment.en: Assignment, i.e., a data item by which a value is assigned to a variable with respect to a particular referent (e.g., T = 200 K for substance o as it was measured in a particular cognitive step); therein, T is the variable, related to the assignment by m4i:hasVariable, 200 K is the value, related to the assignment by m4i:hasValue, and o is the referent, related to the assignment by isAssignmentFor

definition.value: A virtual laser used in synthetic PIV codes.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated), added skos:prefLabel

definition.value: Structure for stating an expanded measurement, model, or simulation uncertainty, e.g., to be applied to an si:Real quantity value
The image manipulation method used by the PIV pre-processing step, e.g. image rotation.
A PIV image, which has been recorded by a camera or created synthetically. To distinguish between physical and synthetical images, use the object property "piv image type".
PIV multi grid method. The correlation and validation methods are executed on different interrogation window sizes starting from large to small.
The correlation method used by the PIV evaluation process

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated), added skos:prefLabel

definition.value: Structure for stating a probabilistic-symmetric coverage interval for a real uncertainty, to be applied to an si:Real quantity value
Specific action undertaken during research
Outlier detection method used to mark or interpolate spurious vectors.
A PIV result distribution containing displacements and optionally other derived variables
A PIV-specific distribution. Subclasses of it are image mask and result distribution which should be used rather than this class. The subclasses describe more clearly the distribution content.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, adjusted german labels, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

definition.value: Quantity value, i.e., a value that has a numerical magnitude and a physical unit

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added german labels, added skos:prefLabel, added skos:definition, added german definition, added instances

definition.value: Eine Organisation ist eine soziale oder rechtliche Institution wie ein Unternehmen, ein Verein usw.
An organization is a social or legal institution such as a company, society, etc.
A model of a digital camera used to generate synthetic PIV images. A set of parameters should be added using h4i:hasParameter and the source code relation using codemeta:hasSourceCode

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, added german label, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

definition.value: Eine Aktivität ist etwas, das über einen Zeitraum und mit oder an Entitäten erfolgt; dazu kann das Verbrauchen, Verarbeiten, Transformieren, Modifizieren, Relokalisieren, Verwenden, oder die Genese von Entitäten gehören.
An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

comment.undefined: DEPRECATED An agent (eg. person, group, software or physical artifact).

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

comment.en: An instance of prov:Association provides additional descriptions about the binary prov:wasAssociatedWith relation from an prov:Activity to some prov:Agent that had some responsiblity for it. For example, :baking prov:wasAssociatedWith :baker; prov:qualifiedssociation [ a prov:Association; prov:agent :baker; :foo :bar ].

definition.value: The PIV evaluation processing performing the correlation algorithm and interrogation method.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added german labels, added skos:prefLabel, added skos:definition, added german definition, added instances

definition.value: A software agent is running software.
Ein Software als Akteur ist ein Stück laufender Programmcode, der eine Aufgabe in einem Prozess übernimmt.

comment.en: If not further specified assume anti-clockwise.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, added german labels, removed redundant notes, extracted from DCAT3-Documentation https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Class:Dataset_Series

definition.value: A collection of datasets that are published separately, but share some common characteristics that groups them.

Abstract description of a method for analysis, generation and transformation of data and material objects like, e.g., 'Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy' or 'Molecular Dynamics Simulation'. Note that while values for relevant parameters should be provided, m4i:Method does not refer to the actual execution of the process that is described (use m4i:ProcessingStep for that), but rather a description of the underlying principle.
Standard single pass interrogation algorithm.
Method used, to replace outliers.
Method to replace vectors identified as invalid by interpolating from surrounding data.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added german labels, added skos:prefLabel, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

note.value: we recommend using a persistent identifier resolving to a persistent URL

definition.value: Kind of quantity, i.e., a physical/chemical quantity from a controlled vocabulary, such as QUDT, IEC, or EMMO

comment.undefined: A quantity kind representing length per pixel in an image.

description.en: Amount of Substance per unit area

example.value: Typically used to describe the particle image density in a PIV image, also known as ppp (particle per pixel).

labels.en: Amount of Substance per Unit Area

comment.en: A Quantity Kind is any observable property that can be measured and quantified numerically. Familiar examples include physical properties such as length, mass, time, force, energy, power, electric charge, etc. Less familiar examples include currency, interest rate, price to earning ratio, and information capacity.

definition.value: Assignment by which a variable (e.g., a physical property) is assigned an si:Real quantity value (scalar x measurement unit) in some context (e.g., applied to some object of research)

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated), added skos:prefLabel

definition.value: (Real value +- uncertainty) x measurement unit, i.e., a scalar value with a measurement unit and an uncertainty indication

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, added german label, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

definition.value: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.
A variable that expects a string of characters as a value
Eine Variable, die eine Zeichenkette als Wert erwartet

example.value: Peak centroid, Paralbolic peak fit or Gaussian peak fit.

comment.en: Method fitting the sub pixel peak in the correlation signal.

definition.value: Particle Image Velocimetry type, e.g. PIV, PTV or other specialized methods.

comment.en: Use this as dct:type of a dcat:Resource. See https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-2/#classifying-dataset-types.

definition.value: A variable that expects a float or integer as a value
Eine Variable, die eine Zahl als Wert erwartet

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added german labels, added skos:prefLabel, added skos:definition, added german definition, added instances, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

definition.value: A role is the function of an entity or agent with respect to an activity, in the context of a usage, generation, invalidation, association, start, and end.
Person on the membership list of a designated project/project team

scopeNote.value: This vocabulary may or may not indicate the quality, quantity, or substance of the person's involvement.

definition.value: Person tasked with reviewing, enhancing, cleaning, or standardizing metadata and the associated data submitted for storage, use, and maintenance within a data centre or repository

scopeNote.value:
While the DataManager is concerned with digital maintenance, the DataCurator's role encompasses quality assurance focused on content and metadata. DataCurator responsibilities include: checking completeness of the submitted dataset against the content as described by the submitter; verifying standard metadata according to the applicable system or schema; adding or verifying specialized metadata to add value and ensure access across disciplines; and determining how the metadata might map to search engines, database products, and automated feeds. Repository managers as well as data librarians working in the repository fall within this category. 

Example: https://doi.org/10.20375/0000-000D-1D1F-2

definition.value: Person or organisation that issued a contract or under the auspices of which a work has been written, printed, published, developed, etc.

scopeNote.value: Includes organisations that provide in-kind support, through donation, provision of people or a facility or instrumentation necessary for the development of the resource, etc.

definition.value: Institution/organisation officially appointed by a Registration Authority to handle specific tasks within a defined area of responsibility

scopeNote.value: DataCite is a Registration Agency for the International DOI Foundation (IDF). One of DataCite’s tasks is to assign DOI prefixes to the allocating agents who then assign the full, specific character string to data clients, provide metadata back to the DataCite registry, etc.

definition.value: Designated administrator over one or more groups/teams working to produce a resource, or over one or more steps of a development process

editorialNote.value: Label adjusted. Do we really need to define all these person roles in our ontology? (GIACOMO)

definition.value: Any person or institution making a significant contribution to the development and/or maintenance of the resource, but whose contribution is notadequately described by any of the other values for contributorType

scopeNote.value: Could be a photographer, artist, or writer whose contribution helped to publicize the resource (as opposed to creating it), a reviewer of the resource, someone providing administrative services to the author (such as depositing updates into an online repository, analysing usage, etc.), or one of many other roles.

definition.value: Person/institution responsible for finding or gathering/collecting data under the guidelines of the author(s) or Principal Investigator (PI)

scopeNote.value: May also be used when crediting survey conductors, interviewers, event or condition observers, or persons responsible for monitoring key instrument data.

definition.value: A person involved in analysing data or the results of an experiment or formal study. May indicate an intern or assistant to one of the authors who helped with research but who was not so “key” as to be listed as an author.

scopeNote.value: Should be a person, not an institution. Note that a person involved in the gathering of data would fall under the contributorType "DataCollector." The researcher may find additional data online and correlate it to the data collected for the experiment or study, for example.

definition.value: Person (or organisation with a staff of data managers, such as a data centre) responsible for maintaining the finished resource

scopeNote.value:
The work done by this person or organisation ensures that the resource is periodically "refreshed" in terms of software/hardware support, is kept available or is protected from unauthorized access, is stored in accordance with industry standards, and is handled in accordance with the records management requirements applicable to it.

Example: https://doi.org/10.6073/pasta/41b3ed2e152e1e4c3846e646118208e7

definition.value: A standards-setting body from which Registration Agencies obtain official recognition and guidance

scopeNote.value: The IDF serves as the Registration Authority for the International Standards Organisation (ISO) in the area/domain of Digital Object Identifiers.

definition.value: Institution tasked with responsibility to generate/disseminate copies of the resource in either electronic or print form

scopeNote.value: Works stored in more than one archive/repository may credit each as a distributor.

definition.value: A person without a specifically defined role in the development of the resource, but who is someone the author wishes to recognize

scopeNote.value: This person could be an author's intellectual mentor, a person providing intellectual leadership in the discipline or subject domain, etc.

definition.value: Person or institution owning or managing property rights, including intellectual property rights over the resource

A Work Package is a recognized data product, not all of which is included in publication. The package, instead, may include notes, discarded documents, etc. The Work Package Leader is responsible for ensuring the comprehensive contents, versioning, and availability of the Work Package during the development of the resource.
Person officially designated as manager of a project. Project may consist of one or many project teams and sub-teams.

scopeNote.value: The manager of a project normally has more administrative responsibility than actual work involvement.

definition.value: Person with knowledge of how to access, troubleshoot, or otherwise field issues related to the resource

scopeNote.value: May also be the "Point of Contact" in an organisation that controls access to the resource, if that organisation is different from the Publisher, Distributor, and Data Manager.

definition.value: Typically, the organisation allowing the resource to be available on the internet through the provision of its hardware/software/operating support

scopeNote.value:
This role normally falls on the University, research center or organization where the data center/data repository belongs.

EXAMPLE: Université Grenoble Alpes (UGA)

May also be used for an organisation that stores the data offline-often a data centre if that data centre is not the "publisher" of the resource.

definition.value: A person who oversees the details related to the publication format of the resource

scopeNote.value: Note: if the Editor is to be credited in place of multiple creators, the Editor's name may be supplied as Creator, with "(Ed.)" appended to the name.

definition.value: Typically refers to a group of individuals with a lab, department, or divisionthathas a specifically defined focus of activity.

scopeNote.value:
May operate at a narrower level of scope; may or may not hold less administrative responsibility than a project team.

Example: Space Research & Planetary Sciences Division of the University of Bern (WP Unibe)

Source: https://doi.org/10.26302/SSHADE/EXPERIMENT_OP_20201104_001

definition.value: Person officially designated as head of project team or sub-project team instrumental in the work necessary to development of the resource

scopeNote.value: The Project Leader is not "removed" from the work that resulted in the resource; he or she remains intimately involved

definition.value: Typically,a person or organisation responsible for the artistry and form of a media product

scopeNote.value: In the data industry, this may be a company "producing" DVDs that package data for future dissemination by a distributor.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added german labels, added skos:prefLabel

comment.en: A record that uniquely describes a particular textual or data publication (or a work in preparation for publication). Each bibliographic record is a set of entities describing aspects of the referenced work, including, for example, but not restricted to: authors, title, journal, publication year, DOI, ISSN, publisher and copyright information, or, in the case of a data publication: creators, title, version, archive, publication year, DOI or other identifier). The FRBR expression of a bibliographic record is a bibliographic reference, which usually contains only a sub-set of these entities, ordered in a particular way that corresponds to the house style of the publication in which it occurs.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, adjusted german labels, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

definition.value: Property, i.e., a variable that can be considered (as an investigated property, i.e., target property) within a processing step

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, adjusted german labels, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)

definition.value: Value, i.e., an articulation that is by social convention understood to be potentially assignable to a variable

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: use of skos:prefLabel instead of rdfs:label, added German label, added language tag to English label, harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated)
changed by m4i: added German definition, added language tag to English definition, shortened definition

comment.de: Ein typischerweise kollektives Unterfangen zum Erreichen eines vorab geplanten Ziels
comment.en: An enterprise (potentially individual but typically collaborative), planned to achieve a particular aim

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added german labels, added skos:prefLabel

definition.value: To say that b is a realizable entity is to say that b is a specifically dependent continuant that inheres in some independent continuant which is not a spatial region and is of a type instances of which are realized in processes of a correlated type. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [058-002])

To say that b is a realizable entity is to say that b is a specifically dependent continuant that inheres in some independent continuant which is not a spatial region and is of a type instances of which are realized in processes of a correlated type. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [058-002])

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added german labels, added skos:prefLabel

definition.value: Process, i.e., a physical entity with a temporal evolution that 'has a meaning for the ontologist'
Declaration that can be applied to an si:Real quantity value to give an assessment of uncertainty
PIV-specific action undertaken during PIV data handling from recording to processing.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: changed label to "research project" (no CamelCase)
changed by m4i: use of skos:prefLabel instead of rdfs:label, added German label, added language tag to English label
changed by m4i: added German definition, added language tag to English definition

definition.value: A PIV multiple pass interrogation window, which uses the local integer displacement in a subsequent interrogation pas by offsetting the the interrogation windows. This increases the singal-to-noise ratio of the coorelation peak as unmatched particle images are avoided.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, added german labels, removed redundant notes, removed other languages than english in comment, label, changeNote and definition

scopeNote.value: The notion of dataset in DCAT is broad and inclusive, with the intention of accommodating resource types arising from all communities. Data comes in many forms including numbers, text, pixels, imagery, sound and other multi-media, and potentially other types, any of which might be collected into a dataset.
This class describes the conceptual dataset. One or more representations might be available, with differing schematic layouts and formats or serializations.

comment.en: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more representations.

definition.value: Object that helps an agent perform an action (e.g., John wrote a book with a pen), i.e., an object of the relation schema:instrument or m4i:hasTool
Points to an assignment that is neither input nor output

definition.value: x starts with y if and only if x has part y and the time point at which x starts is equivalent to the time point at which y starts. Formally: α(y) = α(x) ∧ ω(y) < ω(x), where α is a function that maps a process to a start point, and ω is a function that maps a process to an end point.

definition.value: x ends with y if and only if x has part y and the time point at which x ends is equivalent to the time point at which y ends. Formally: α(y) > α(x) ∧ ω(y) = ω(x), where α is a function that maps a process to a start point, and ω is a function that maps a process to an end point.
Name for a standard name, e.g. "x_velocity". The construction of a standard name string is defined by the standard name table. E.g. no spaces are allowed and specific pre- and suffixes are allowed.

definition.value: (x isAdmissibleValueFor y) means that x is a value that can be assigned to the variable y; subsumption under msIPIRIR is explained as follows: There is a sign z for the variable y (where z is the range of admissible values of y), for which in turn there is another sign z' (where z' lists members of z, explicitly including x) of which x is a part

definition.value: The compression format of the distribution in which the data is contained in a compressed form, e.g. to reduce the size of the downloadable file.

scopeNote.value: This property is to be used when the files in the distribution are compressed, e.g. in a ZIP file. The format SHOULD be expressed using a media type as defined by IANA media types registry https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/, if available.

definition.value: A systematically built alphanumeric string that identifies a unique object (e.g. a person, a publication, an organisation, a research activity, a sample, etc.) or a unique class of objects.

definition.value: The package format of the distribution in which one or more data files are grouped together, e.g. to enable a set of related files to be downloaded together.

scopeNote.value: This property to be used when the files in the distribution are packaged, e.g. in a TAR file, a Frictionless Data Package or a Bagit file. The format SHOULD be expressed using a media type as defined by IANA media types registry https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/, if available.

definition.value: Minimum spatial separation resolvable in a dataset, measured in metres.

scopeNote.value: If the dataset is an image or grid this should correspond to the spacing of items. For other kinds of spatial dataset, this property will usually indicate the smallest distance between items in the dataset.
Alternative spatial resolutions might be provided as different dataset distributions.

definition.value: The flag meanings data property provides the string representations of the pvmeta:flagValues data property.

example.value:
For pivmeta:flagValues=[0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128], the meaning could be:
pivmeta:flagMeanings=["inactive", "active", "masked", "noresult", "disabled", "filtered", "interpolated", "replaced", "manualedit"]

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: added skos:prefLabel, added german label

comment.en:
The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

editorialNote.value: changed by m4i: harmonized spelling to OBO naming conventions (lower case, space separated), added skos:prefLabel

definition.value: The standard measurement uncertainty is the measurement uncertainty expressed as a standard deviation
Relates an si:Real to its expanded uncertainty
The data property flag values provides binary flag values which are explained by pivmeta:flagValues. From the flag values, new flags can be computed by bitwise OR operation, e.g. 1 | 16=17.

example.value:
pivmeta:flagValues=[0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128].

The corresponding meaning would be:
pivmeta:flagMeanings=["inactive", "active", "masked", "noresult", "disabled", "filtered", "interpolated", "replaced", "manualedit"]

A flag value of 17 means "active and filtered", which is obtained by bitwise AND operation.

A JSON-LD excerpt could look like this:
{
    "@type": "m4i:NumericalVariable",
    "pivmeta:flagValues": [0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128],
    "pivmeta:flagMeanings": [
        "inactive",
        "active",
        "masked",
        "noresult",
        "disabled",
        "filtered", 
        "interpolated",
        "replaced", 
        "manualedit"
    ],
    "units": "http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/M-PER-SEC"
}

definition.value: The number of records. A record describes the number of images needed for the evaluation of a single PIV velocity field. E.g. a double image recording stored in two separate files A1.tiff and B1.tiff counts as one record. Hence, the number of records correspond to the number of velocity fields, if all records are taken into account in the evluation process.

x precedes y if and only if the time point at which x ends is before or equivalent to the time point at which y starts. Formally: x precedes y iff ω(x) <= α(y), where α is a function that maps a process to a start point, and ω is a function that maps a process to an end point.

comment.en:
The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.
